remarks: The power set of a set is equinumerous to set exponentiation with an unordered pair base of ordinal 2.  Generalized from Proposition 10.44 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 96.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Oct-2014.)
statement:
pw2f1o.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
pw2f1o.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. W ) $.
pw2f1o.3 $e |- ( ph -> C e. W ) $.
pw2f1o.4 $e |- ( ph -> B =/= C ) $.
pw2f1o.5 $e |- F = ( x e. ~P A |-> ( z e. A |-> if ( z e. x , C , B ) ) ) $.
pw2f1o $p |- ( ph -> F : ~P A -1-1-onto-> ( { B , C } ^m A ) ) $.
$d A x z $.
$d B x z $.
$d C x z $.
$d ph x $.
$d x z $.
